org.efaps.update.schema.program.esjp

Class ESJPCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.update.schema.program.esjp.ESJPCompiler

  • public class ESJPCompiler
extends Object
    The class is used to compile all checked in ESJP programs. Because the dependencies of a class are not known, all ESJP programs stored in eFaps are compiled.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

    • Method Detail

      • compile

        public void compile(String _debug,
           boolean _addRuntimeClassPath)
             throws InstallationException
        All stored ESJP programs in eFaps are compiled. The system Java compiler defined from the tool provider is used for the compiler. All old not needed compiled Java classes are automatically removed. The compiler error and warning are logged (errors are using error-level, warnings are using info-level).
        Debug:
        • null: By default, only line number and source file information is generated.
        • "none": Do not generate any debugging information
        • Generate only some kinds of debugging information, specified by a comma separated list of keywords. Valid keywords are:
          • "source": Source file debugging information
          • "lines": Line number debugging information
          • "vars": Local variable debugging information
        Parameters:
        _debug - String for the debug option
        _addRuntimeClassPath - Must the classpath from the runtime added to the compiler, default: false
        Throws:
        InstallationException - if the compile failed

      • readESJPPrograms

        protected void readESJPPrograms()
                         throws InstallationException
        All EJSP programs in the eFaps database are read and stored in the mapping name2Source for further using.
        Throws:
        InstallationException - if ESJP Java programs could not be read
        See Also:
        name2Source

      • readESJPClasses

        protected void readESJPClasses()
                        throws InstallationException
        All stored compiled ESJP's classes in the eFaps database are stored in the mapping class2id. If a ESJP's program is compiled and stored with ESJPCompiler.StoreObject.write(), the class is removed. After the compile, ESJPCompiler#compile(String) removes all stored classes which are not needed anymore.
        Throws:
        InstallationException - if read of the ESJP classes failed
        See Also:
        class2id
